participant.name: Riza Fahmi
participant.profile:
I love to learn bleeding edge and new technology and enjoy to share with fellow developers that need a guidance and upgrade their skill so they can have a better career or do their own business.

I'm the Curriculum Director of Hacktiv8, a company I started with Ronald Ishak, in an attempt to solve the developer hiring crunch that has hindered the growth of many aspiring tech startups in Indonesia. Through a 12-week immersive curriculum offered through Hacktiv8, aims to raise the quality of web developers and connect them with the best tech companies in the country.

Knowledge sharing is deeply engrained with my passion and is evident through involvement in many initiatives such as becoming a lecturer at Universitas Budi Luhur; becoming an organizer for JakartaJS and Meteor Jakarta; a speaker at Singapore Elixir Meetup, GeekCamp, Lambda Jakarta and much more to come. In my free time, I'm hosts a podcast called AppsCoast, a podcast of interviews aspiring startup founders, and technologists and uncover their mission. 

Technology is the core to solving the next generation of problems and by teaching people the foundations of programming, I believe we can solve Indonesia’s future problems together.

participant.name: Ivan Kristianto
participant.profile:
Ivan is a Senior Web Engineer at 10up, a global technology agency serving enterprise clients from various industries. As part of the team, his focus is mainly in content publishing platform. Active in Indonesia WordPress community both speaking and organising events. 

He love to explore new web technologies—like WordPress, AMP, PWA, Service Worker, Docker, and React. He has been a major contributor to some WordPress plugins and WordPress Core. 

With his experience from industry and academic, Ivan is passionately interested to help international business clients especially in content publishing platform.

participant.name: Zulwiyoza Putra
participant.profile:
Hi, I'm Zulwiyoza Putra. I'm Software Engineer at Kibar in 40 hours of my life in a week (can be more LOL :D) and a human being who want to make a world become a better place for the rest of its 40 hours. I work with iOS, React, Django, and Flask for production.

I quit from ITB as a business student earlier in 2015 to pursue informal computer science education in San Francisco for 2 years. To survive with really minimum cash in the pocket I live in Tenderloin for almost 2 years for cheaper rent with 2 roommates, the most sketchy neighborhood in the heart of San Francisco with high crime rate, drugs, and prostitution. I used to work as food delivery guy to provide me living cost since my scholarship only covers tuition.

My first computer is when I was 7 years old my dad bring home a huge Pentium III with windows 98 operating system. It was that rare at that time since I live in pretty small city like Dumai. The first app I built was a tip calculator called Tipsify. https://appadvice.com/game/app/tipsify/1134835037. I shipped it to the app store in July 2016.

My mom is a middle school teacher and I think that's why I love to to teach and share my knowledge. This is the best way to me to learn faster. :)

FYI, I have Cities Skyline on my 15" Mac for killing time if I don't have a tight deadline. Cities Skyline is the only game I have and I play since it's super fun. I promise!

I only 3 things that anyone can't stop from me. Learning, code, and play cities skyline.

Talk to me about iOS, Swift, React and Cities Skyline! ;)
